honeywell.connection

Class ConnectionBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • honeywell.connection.ConnectionBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Connection_Bluetooth, Connection_TCP, Connection_UDP

    public abstract class ConnectionBase
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class encapsulates all of the different connection methods into a single uniform base class. The main purpose of this set of classes is for communication with an ONeil printer, but it can be used to connect to any device that supports the protocols here in. Using the ConnectionBase object type is a good way to make a generalized set of routines that can accept any type of connection.

    • Method Detail

      • getIsOpen

        public boolean getIsOpen()
        Is the connection open. This is true when the connection is open or listening and false if we have never connected or the connection was closed.
        Returns:
        True when the connection is open or listening.

      • getIsActive

        public boolean getIsActive()
        Is the connection open and talking to a target device. For client connections this is the same as isOpen(), but for servers isOpen means we are listening and isActive means we are connected.
        Returns:
        True when connection open and talking to a target device.

      • getBytesAvailable

        public long getBytesAvailable()
        This will return the number of bytes that are ready to be read from the device. Data received from the target device is read asynchronously and stored in an internal buffer. So this value is the number of bytes that have been received and are being stored locally.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes that are ready to be read.

      • getIsServerMode

        public boolean getIsServerMode()
        Are we in server mode. This is true if the current connection is for a server or false if it is for a client.
        Returns:
        Are we in server mode.

      • getIsClientMode

        public boolean getIsClientMode()
        Are we in client mode. This is true if the current connection is for a client or false if it is for a server.
        Returns:
        Are we in client mode.

      • clearReadBuffer

        public void clearReadBuffer()
        This will Clear the data waiting in the read buffer.

      • clearWriteBuffer

        public void clearWriteBuffer()
        This will Clear the data waiting in the write buffer.

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
        This will return all of the current data read from the device in the form of a string.
        Returns:
        All of the current data read from the device in the form of a string.

      • read

        public java.lang.String read(java.lang.String endSequence,
                             long msecTimeout)
        This will read data from the connection returning up to and including the end sequence is found or after the wait from the last bit of data is equal to or greater than the timeout.
        Parameters:
        endSequence - String that marks the end of the data stream.
        msecTimeout - Maximum amount of time to wait for data.
        Returns:
        The string returned.

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine(java.lang.String endSequence,
                                 long msecTimeout)
        This will read data from the connection returning up to and including the line containing the end sequence or after the wait from the last bit of data is equal to or greater than the timeout.
        Parameters:
        endSequence - String that marks the end of the data stream.
        msecTimeout - Maximum amount of time to wait for data.
        Returns:
        The string returned.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buffer,
                int offset,
                int length)
        This will write the current data read from the device into the buffer up to the provided length starting at the offset.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to write data into.
        offset - Index of where to start writing into the buffer.
        length - Maximum amount of data to read into buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String data)
        This will write the provided String to the device.
        Parameters:
        data - Text string to write.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] buffer)
        This will write the data to the device from buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to read data from.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] buffer,
                  int offset,
                  int length)
        This will write the data to the device from buffer starting at the given offset up to the length indicated.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to read data from.
        offset - Index of where to start reading from the buffer.
        length - Amount of data to read from buffer.

      • open

        public boolean open()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This will open the current connection if not open. The base class function handles the starting of the threads used to do the asynchronous communication with the device. The derived class will do the device specific routines.
        Returns:
        Was the open successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if open fails badly.
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitForEmptyBuffer

        public boolean waitForEmptyBuffer(int timeout_msec)
        This function will wait, up to the given timeout in msec, for the sending queue to be empty. The function will return true if the queue is empty, or false if it wasn't empty by the end of the time out. Only applies to asynchronous connection.
        Parameters:
        timeout_msec - Number of msec to wait for the sending queue to be empty.
        Returns:
        True if the queue was empty before the timeout.

      • close

        public void close()
        This will close the current connection if open.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A detailed description of the configuration. This is a verbose version of the connection configuration.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Thread

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String format)
        A description of the configuration. This version allows the detail verboseness to be specified.
        Parameters:
        format - Format of the data to be returned. 'L' is for long, 'C' is for compact and 'S' is for short.
        Returns:
        This will return a string with a description of the configuration.

      • run

        public void run()
        This will start the communication thread and handle all of the asynchronous reading and writing to the device.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
